alert.note: Alert for Bolivar Peninsula; Brazoria Islands; Galveston Island; Matagorda Islands (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Beach Hazards Statement issued November 14 at 3:17PM CST until November 15 at 3:00AM CST by NWS Houston - Galveston
info.description: ...BEACH HAZARDS STATEMENT IN EFFECT UNTIL 3 AM CST TUESDAY... ...HIGH RIP CURRENT RISK HAS BEEN MERGED INTO THIS STATEMENT... * WHAT...High risk of risk of rip currents. Elevated tide levels this evening. * WHERE...Matagorda Islands, Brazoria Islands, Galveston Island and Bolivar Peninsula Counties. * WHEN...Until 3 AM CST Tuesday. * IMPACTS...Rip currents can sweep even the best swimmers away from shore into deeper water. Elevated surf and wave run up may approach lowest lying Gulf facing roads for a short time period this evening. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Strong east and southeast winds have driven water levels up and are running about 2 feet above normal. Higher than normal wave run up along Gulf facing beaches is expected this evening and water may approach the lowest waterfront roadways along the Bolivar Peninsula, Bluewater Highway and Surfside this evening as we head into high tide. These levels should level off fairly quickly late this evening and then begin to steadily fall as a cold front pushes through and northerly winds drive water back out.
info.instruction: Remain out of the water to avoid hazardous swimming conditions.

area.areaDesc: Bolivar Peninsula; Brazoria Islands; Galveston Island; Matagorda Islands
